lead_paragraph: Edison Peña, once enclosed in a wall of rock, thought he would never see sunlight again. Now he will be standing on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge on Sunday morning with 43,000 other runners, starting a 26.2-mile race that, for him, is but a victory lap.
snippet: Edison Peña, once enclosed in a wall of rock, thought he would never see sunlight again. Now he will be standing on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge on Sunday morning with 43,000 other runners, starting a 26.2-mile race that, for him, is but a victory...

headline.main: Chilean Miner to Run New York City Marathon

abstract: Edison Peña, once enclosed in a wall of rock, thought he would never see sunlight again. Now he will be standing on the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge on Sunday morning with 43,000 other runners, starting a 26.2-mile race that, for him, is but a victory lap.
